required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect on Blood Cells, Known as Platelets, Using Prasugrel vs Clopidogrel in Patients With the Heart Problem Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Double-Blind Cross-Over Study Comparing the Pharmacodynamic (PD)Response in Subjects With ACS Receiving 14 Days 10-mg Maintenance Dose (MD) Prasugrel vs 14 Days 150-mg MD Clopidogrel After Using a 900-mg Loading Dose (LD) of Clopidogrel to Reduce Ongoing Platelet Activation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, cross-over study to compare the pharmacodynamic response in subjects with Acute Coronary Syndrome receiving a 10-mg maintenance dose (MD) of prasugrel compared with a 150-mg maintenance dose of clopidogrel, following a 900-mg loading dose (LD) of clopidogrel.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Platelet Aggregation (MPA) to 20 Micromolar (μM) Adenosine Diphosphate (ADP)
primary_outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation (MPA) to 20 μM adenosine diphosphate (ADP) was assessed by light transmission aggregometry (LTA).

secondary_outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation to 5 μM ADP was assessed by LTA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Residual Platelet Aggregation (RPA) to 20 µM ADP
secondary_outcome.description: Residual platelet aggregation is the percentage (%) aggregation value as measured by LTA at 6 minutes after the addition of ADP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Residual Platelet Aggregation (RPA) to 5 µM ADP
secondary_outcome.description: Residual platelet aggregation is the percentage (%) aggregation value as measured by LTA at 6 minutes after the addition of ADP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inhibition Platelet Aggregation (IPA) to 20 μM ADP
secondary_outcome.description: IPA is calculated as a percent decrease of MPA from baseline using the following formula: ([MPA at baseline - MPA at time of postbaseline] / MPA at baseline) x 100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Inhibition Platelet Aggregation (IPA) to 5 μM ADP
secondary_outcome.description: IPA is calculated as a percent decrease of MPA from baseline using the following formula: ([MPA at baseline - MPA at time of postbaseline] / MPA at baseline) x 100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Inhibition of Residual Platelet Aggregation (IRPA) to 20 μM ADP
secondary_outcome.description: IRPA is calculated as a percent decrease of RPA from baseline using the following formula: ([RPA at baseline - RPA at time of postbaseline] / RPA at baseline) x 100%

secondary_outcome.measure: Inhibition of Residual Platelet Aggregation (IRPA) to 5 μM ADP
secondary_outcome.description: IRPA is calculated as a percent decrease of RPA from baseline using the following formula: ([RPA at baseline - RPA at time of postbaseline] / RPA at baseline) x 100%

Platelet Reactivity Index percentage was assessed by Vasodilator-stimulated phosphoprotein (VASP). PRI percent (%) was calculated using the median fluorescence intensity (MFI) of samples included with prostaglandin E1 (PGE1) and ADP, according to the following formula: PRI%=[(MFI(PGE1)-MFI(PGE1 + ADP)/MFI(PGE1)]x100 Lower PRI% values indicate greater P2Y12 receptor blockade.

P2Y12 Reaction Units (PRU) assessed by Accumetrics Verify NowTM P2Y12. PRU represents the rate and extent of adenosine (ADP)-stimulated platelet aggregation. Lower values indicate greater P2Y12 platelet inhibition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Poor Responder of MPA to 20 μM ADP Following Maintenance Dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.description: Poor responder is defined as MPA to 20 μM ADP >75th percentile of the value at 6-18 hours post-clopidogrel LD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in MPA to 20 μM ADP From Baseline to 6-18 Hrs Post Loading Dose (LD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 6-18 hrs post loading dose (LD)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation to 20 μM ADP was assessed by LTA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in MPA to 20 μM ADP From 6-18 Hrs Post Loading Dose (LD) to 14 Days After the First Maintenance Dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-18 hrs post loading dose (LD) to 14 days after the first maintenance dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation to 20 μM ADP was assessed by LTA.

secondary_outcome.measure: MPA to 20 μM ADP at 14 Days After the First Maintenance Dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days after the first maintenance dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation to 20 μM ADP was assessed by LTA.

secondary_outcome.measure: MPA to 20 μM ADP at 14 Days After the Second Maintenance Dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 14 days after the second maintenance dose (MD)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation to 20 μM ADP was assessed by LTA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events According to Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction Study Group (TIMI) Criteria
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding events will be classified as Major Bleeding, Minor Bleeding, or Insignificant Bleeding according to the TIMI criteria. Major bleeding: any intracranial hemorrhage (ICH) OR any clinically overt bleeding (including bleeding evident on imaging studies) associated with a fall in hemoglobin (Hgb) of ≥5 gm/dL from baseline. Minor Bleeding: any clinically overt bleeding associated with a fall in Hgb of ≥3 grams/deciliter (gm/dL) but <5 gm/dL from baseline. Insignificant bleeding: any bleeding event that does not meet criteria for a Major or Minor bleed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events According to Global Use of Strategies to Open Occluded Coronary Arteries (GUSTO)
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding events will be classified according to the GUSTO definitions as follows: Severe or Life-Threatening Bleeding: any ICH OR any bleeding event resulting in substantial hemodynamic compromise requiring treatment. Moderate Bleeding: any bleeding event resulting in the need for transfusion. Minor bleeding: any other bleeding event that does not require transfusion or cause hemodynamic compromise.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of MPA to 20 μM ADP and PRU
secondary_outcome.description: Pearson-correlation estimated between MPA to 20 μM ADP and Accumetrics VerifyNowTM P2Y12 PRU

arm_group.description: Open label lead-in one time dose of Clopidogrel 900 mg oral tablets (a single or cumulative dose) and 250 mg to 500 mg aspirin loading dose (LD), either orally or intravenously. Patients are then assigned to maintenance dose (MD) prasugrel 10 mg and two placebo tablets, matched to clopidogrel, and 100 mg aspirin, all taken orally once a day for 14 days. Patients cross-over to MD of clopidogrel two 75 mg tablets and one placebo matched to prasugrel and 100 mg aspirin, all taken orally once a day for the next 14 days.

Open label lead-in one time dose of Clopidogrel 900 mg oral tablets (a single or cumulative dose) and 250 mg to 500 mg aspirin loading dose (LD), either orally or intravenously. Patients are then assigned to maintenance dose (MD) Clopidogrel two 75 mg and one placebo tablet, matched to prasugrel, and 100 mg aspirin, all taken orally once a day for 14 days. Patients cross-over to MD of prasugrel one 10 mg tablet and two placebo tablets matched to clopidogrel and 100 mg aspirin, all taken orally once a day for the next 14 days.

intervention.description: Prasugrel 10-mg tablet taken orally as a daily maintenance dose for a 14-day treatment period.
Clopidogrel two 75-mg tablets taken orally as a daily maintenance dose for a 14-day treatment period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Present with acute coronary syndrome (ACS) and have planned treatment with a one-time 900-mg loading dose of commercially available clopidogrel (administered as a single or cumulative dose).
- Are between the ages of 18 and 85 years.
- Willing and able to sign informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have overt ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI).
- Have cardiogenic shock.
- Have refractory ventricular arrhythmias.
- Have New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class IV congestive heart failure.
- Have severe and uncontrolled hypertension.
- Have active internal bleeding or history of bleeding diathesis.
- Have an increased risk of bleeding.
- Have history of cerebrovascular accidents.
- Have certain abnormal blood level values.
- Are currently receiving chemotherapy or radiation therapy.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 56 patients received a clopidogrel loading dose (LD) of 900 mg and were then randomized to receive a maintenance dose (MD) of either 10-mg prasugrel or 150-mg clopidogrel. Two patients withdrew from the study after randomization but prior to receiving a MD, one due to subject decision and one due to physician decision.

group.title: Prasugrel/Clopidogrel
group.description: One time oral loading dose (LD) of 900-mg clopidogrel (a single or cumulative dose)followed by a once daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for 14 days. Patients cross-over to a daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin for an additional 14 days.

group.title: Clopidogrel/Prasugrel
group.description: One time oral loading dose (LD) of 900-mg clopidogrel (a single or cumulative dose)followed by a once daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for 14 days. Patients cross-over to a daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin for an additional 14 days.

group.title: Loading Dose
group.description: Clopidogrel 900-mg Loading Dose (a single or cumulative dose)

participants_list.participants: Two patients withdrew from the study after randomization but prior to receiving the 1st MD.
1 patient discontinued prior to the 2nd MD Period (Sponsor decision due to early study termination)
2 patients discontinued prior to the 2nd MD Period (Sponsor decision due to early study termination)

group.title: Prasugrel/Clopidogrel
group.description: One time oral loading dose (LD) of 900-mg clopidogrel (a single or cumulative dose) followed by a once daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for 14 days. Patients cross-over to a daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin for an additional 14 days.

group.title: Clopidogrel/Prasugrel
group.description: One time oral loading dose (LD) of 900-mg clopidogrel (a single or cumulative dose) followed by a once daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for 14 days. Patients cross-over to a daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin for an additional 14 days.

outcome.title: Maximum Platelet Aggregation (MPA) to 20 Micromolar (μM) Adenosine Diphosphate (ADP)
outcome.description: Maximum platelet aggregation (MPA) to 20 μM adenosine diphosphate (ADP) was assessed by light transmission aggregometry (LTA).
outcome.population: The primary analysis was performed on the intent-to-treat (ITT) population, that is, all randomized subjects with a maintenance dose MPA measured for at least one of the treatments.

group.description: Prasugrel (10-mg MD) + Aspirin (≤100-mg MD) (Prasugrel + Aspirin is administered once daily, either in the first or second MD period)

group.title: Clopidogrel
group.description: Clopidogrel (150-mg MD) + Aspirin (≤100-mg MD) (Clopidogrel + Aspirin is administered once daily, either in the first or second MD periods)

outcome.title: Inhibition Platelet Aggregation (IPA) to 20 μM ADP
outcome.description: IPA is calculated as a percent decrease of MPA from baseline using the following formula: ([MPA at baseline – MPA at time of postbaseline] / MPA at baseline) x 100%
outcome.population: Note: This was calculated only for subjects with a true clopidogrel-free measure at baseline (Visit 1)

outcome.title: Platelet Reactivity Index (PRI)
outcome.description: Platelet Reactivity Index percentage was assessed by Vasodilator-stimulated phosphoprotein (VASP). PRI percent (%) was calculated using the median fluorescence intensity (MFI) of samples included with prostaglandin E1 (PGE1) and ADP, according to the following formula: PRI%=[(MFI(PGE1)-MFI(PGE1 + ADP)/MFI(PGE1)]x100 Lower PRI% values indicate greater P2Y12 receptor blockade.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events According to Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction Study Group (TIMI) Criteria
outcome.description: Bleeding events will be classified as Major Bleeding, Minor Bleeding, or Insignificant Bleeding according to the TIMI criteria. Major bleeding: any intracranial hemorrhage (ICH) OR any clinically overt bleeding (including bleeding evident on imaging studies) associated with a fall in hemoglobin (Hgb) of ≥5 gm/dL from baseline. Minor Bleeding: any clinically overt bleeding associated with a fall in Hgb of ≥3 grams/deciliter (gm/dL) but <5 gm/dL from baseline. Insignificant bleeding: any bleeding event that does not meet criteria for a Major or Minor bleed.

measure.description: Bleeding events will be classified as Major Bleeding, Minor Bleeding, or Insignificant Bleeding according to the TIMI criteria. Major bleeding: any intracranial hemorrhage (ICH) OR any clinically overt bleeding (including bleeding evident on imaging studies) associated with a fall in hemoglobin (Hgb) of ≥5 gm/dL from baseline. Minor Bleeding: any clinically overt bleeding associated with a fall in Hgb of ≥3 grams/deciliter (gm/dL) but <5 gm/dL from baseline. Insignificant bleeding: any bleeding event that does not meet criteria for a Major or Minor bleed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events According to Global Use of Strategies to Open Occluded Coronary Arteries (GUSTO)
outcome.description: Bleeding events will be classified according to the GUSTO definitions as follows: Severe or Life-Threatening Bleeding: any ICH OR any bleeding event resulting in substantial hemodynamic compromise requiring treatment. Moderate Bleeding: any bleeding event resulting in the need for transfusion. Minor bleeding: any other bleeding event that does not require transfusion or cause hemodynamic compromise.

group.title: Intent-to-treat Population
group.description: Both clopidogrel and prasugrel combined population

measure.title: Correlation of MPA to 20 μM ADP and PRU
measure.description: Pearson-correlation estimated between MPA to 20 μM ADP and Accumetrics VerifyNowTM P2Y12 PRU

group.title: Clopidogrel 900 mg LD
group.description: One time oral loading dose (LD) of 900-mg clopidogrel

group.title: Prasugrel 10 mg - 1st MD
group.description: Once daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for 14 days.

group.title: Clopidogrel 150 mg - 1st MD
group.description: Once daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for 14 days.

group.title: Clopidogrel 150 mg - Crossover From Prasugrel 10 mg
group.description: Once daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for an additional 14 days. These are patients who received a daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin during the 1st MD period.

group.title: Prasugrel 10 mg - Crossover From Clopidogrel 150 mg
group.description: Once daily MD of prasugrel 10 mg and 100 mg aspirin, for an additional 14 days. These are patients who received a daily MD of clopidogrel 150 mg and 100 mg aspirin during the 1st MD period.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
